title: Former Des Moines Register reporter Aaron Calvin plays the victim in new interview with BuzzFeed
text:
Oh, it’s real. . .

this

can't

be

real — David Burge (@iowahawkblog) September 28, 2019

Here’s former Des Moines Register reporter Aaron Calvin playing the victim in a new interview for BuzzFeed and blaming “right-wing ideologues” for his downfall:

You’re not going to believe this. But Aaron Calvin is now the victim everyone. I couldn’t have foreseen this coming. pic.twitter.com/8SPZkD3OhM — Stephen Miller (@redsteeze) September 27, 2019

And Calvin really didn’t like his old tweets being used against him by his employer:

Aaron Calvin has thoughts on old out of context tweets. pic.twitter.com/WnjhOHthYR — Stephen Miller (@redsteeze) September 27, 2019

“Buzzfeed to the rescue”:

Not exactly helping his case as fair impartial good faith journalist here. And of course it’s Buzzfeed to the rescue. — Stephen Miller (@redsteeze) September 27, 2019

Still on this is how I imagine Jesus or Nelson Mandela must have felt. — Stephen Miller (@redsteeze) September 27, 2019

The part where he compared himself to women and people of color was a nice touch:

Wait hold the F up. He dares to compare himself to receiving the vitriol women or people of color get on here? Is he not aware that he did this very thing to a college kid?! That’s why his own hypocrisy was brought up. Also LOL at you being a “right wing idealogue.” — Britt McHenry (@BrittMcHenry) September 27, 2019

The good news the controversy helped Carson King raise even more money, with the total raised now in excess of $2 million:

He said he will announce the final total from his campaign on Tuesday, once the fundraiser ends. https://t.co/fQCoTCNR4a — Des Moines Register (@DMRegister) September 27, 2019

You can read the whole thing here:

Former Des Moines Register Reporter Aaron Calvin, the reporter who dug into Iowa viral charity hero Carson King’s tweets from when he was 16, now tells Buzzfeed: “This whole campaign was taken up by right-wing ideologues and largely driven by that force.” https://t.co/8eOns91XqQ — Joe Concha (@JoeConchaTV) September 27, 2019
